alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 03 at 10:54AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kansas, including the following county, Douglas. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1052 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated another round of heavy rain moving through. This is causing urban and small stream flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Lawrence and Lecompton.
info.instruction: In hilly terrain, low water crossings are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
